item.title: Julia v1.1-rc1 from source
item.description: Learning more about Julia is one of the many things I attempt to do in 2019 ðŸ˜„. It was quite easy, all I had to do was: git checkout master git pull git checkout v1.1.0-rc1 make 1h13min42sec latter, julia 1.

item.title: Building Julia 1.0.0 from sources on Debian Testing
item.description: You may have already heard about Julia. Well, I am not (yet) a regular user but Julia’s performances are impressive, the langage is well-thought and the community is growing super fast, I therefore pay careful attention to what’s happening on their side. Recently, version 1.0.0 was released, so I decided to replace my local version v0.4.7.9 I installed with apt-get (note that currently v0.7.0-2 is available for Sid). There are two ways to install Julia for Debian without apt-get.
